<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>exhibit31_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
    <title>exhibit31_1.htm</title>
    <!--Licensed to: Alanco Technologies, Inc.-->
    <!--Document Created using EDGARizer 2020 5.5.0.0-->
    <!--Copyright 1995 - 2014 Thomson Reuters. All rights reserved.-->
</head>
<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<br>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">EXHIBIT 31.1</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certification of</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">President and Chief Executive Officer</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">of Alanco Technologies, Inc.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, John A. Carlson, certify that:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1.&#160;&#160;I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-K of Alanco Technologies, Inc.;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Date:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;September 28, 2015</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="25%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="20%">

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="20%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">_______________________________</font></font></div>

</tr><tr>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">President and Chief Executive Officer</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">EXHIBIT 31.2</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certification of</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Chief Financial Officer</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">of Alanco Technologies, Inc.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Danielle Haney, certify that:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1.&#160;&#160;I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-K of Alanco Technologies, Inc.;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Date:&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;September 28, 2015</font></div>

<TYPE>EX-32
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>exhibit32.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 32
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
    <title>exhibit32.htm</title>
    <!--Licensed to: Alanco Technologies, Inc.-->
    <!--Document Created using EDGARizer 2020 5.5.0.0-->
    <!--Copyright 1995 - 2014 Thomson Reuters. All rights reserved.-->
</head>
<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<br>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">EXHIBIT 32</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with the quarterly report of Alanco Technologies, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-K for the period ending June 30, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), John A. Carlson, as President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company and Danielle Haney, as Chief Financial Officer of the Company, each hereby certifies, to the best of his/her knowledge, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>

    <us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/b&gt; - Alanco&#13;Technologies, Inc. (Stock Symbol: ALAN) was incorporated in 1969 under the laws of the State of Arizona. Unless otherwise noted,&#13;the &amp;#34;Company&amp;#34; or &amp;#147;Alanco&amp;#148; refers to Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries. During the&#13;fiscal year ended June 30, 2012, the Company formed Alanco Energy Services, Inc. (&amp;#147;AES&amp;#148;), for the purpose of obtaining&#13;property to establish a water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO to receive produced water generated as a byproduct from&#13;oil and natural gas production in Western Colorado. The new facility started to receive produced water in August 2012. See Note&#13;5 - Alanco Energy Services for discussion of AES transactions.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 9pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; These consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted&#13;in the United States (GAAP). The consolidated financial statements for the years ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 include, where appropriate,&#13;the accounts of Alanco Technologies, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Alanco Energy Services, Inc. and StarTrak Systems,&#13;LLC (&amp;#147;StarTrak&amp;#148;) (collectively, the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;). Alanco is an Arizona corporation, Alanco Energy Services,&#13;Inc. is a Colorado corporation and StarTrak is a Delaware LLC. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been&#13;eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; Certain&#13;prior year numbers have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation. Sales tax on certain revenues for the fiscal&#13;year 2014 that were classified as cost of revenues has been reclassified in the Consolidated Statement of Operations to offset&#13;revenues to conform to the current year&amp;#146;s presentation. This reclassification had no effect on net loss or net loss per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/b&gt; -&#13;The Company considers all highly liquid instruments with maturities of three months or less at the time of purchase to be cash&#13;equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150;&#13;The Company operates the Deer Creek water disposal facility near Grand Junction, CO and bills customers (primarily in the oil and&#13;gas industry) for produced water received. The Company generally recognizes revenue at the time the produced water is received&#13;at the Deer Creek facility, filtered and billed. In addition, the Company has revenue from oil reclamation and generally recognizes&#13;oil revenue when the oil is picked up by the customer. Water and related oil revenues can be impacted by weather conditions and&#13;the prices of oil and gas which may impact drilling activities. Revenue is generally recognized when all the following have been&#13;met:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The service has been performed or product&#13;delivered;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The customer&amp;#146;s fee is deemed to be&#13;determinable and free of contingencies or significant uncertainties; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 10pt Courier New, Courier, Monospace; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 45pt"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18pt"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Collectability is probable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27pt"&gt;Any sales tax for which the&#13;Company is responsible is recorded as a reduction of the associated revenue.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Accounts Receivable - Trade and&#13;Other&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company provides for potentially uncollectible trade accounts receivable and other receivables by use of&#13;the allowance method. An allowance for doubtful accounts is provided based upon a review of the individual accounts outstanding,&#13;the Company&amp;#146;s prior history of collections and the customer&amp;#146;s credit worthiness. The Company charges off uncollectible&#13;receivables when all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. The Company does not typically accrue interest or fees&#13;on past due amounts and the receivables are generally unsecured. The Company&amp;#146;s allowance for doubtful accounts receivable&#13;was approximately $0 and $1,000 at June 30, 2015 and 2014, respectively. No allowance was established as of June 30, 2015 as all&#13;receivables were deemed fully collectible.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes Receivable&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The&#13;Company provides for potentially uncollectible notes receivable by use of the allowance method. An allowance for uncollectible&#13;notes receivable is provided based upon a review of the individual notes outstanding and the note holder&amp;#146;s credit worthiness.&#13;The Company charges off uncollectible notes receivable when all reasonable collection efforts have been exhausted. Interest income&#13;from notes receivable is recognized when earned. There was no allowance for doubtful notes receivable at June 30, 2015 and 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Marketable Securities &amp;#150; &lt;/b&gt;The&#13;Company determines the appropriate classification of its investments in marketable equity securities at the time of acquisition&#13;and re-evaluates such determinations at each balance sheet date. Marketable securities are classified as held to maturity when&#13;the Company has the positive intent and ability to hold securities to maturity. Marketable securities that are bought and held&#13;principally for the purpose of selling them in the near term are classified as trading securities and are reported at fair value,&#13;with the unrealized gains and losses recognized in earnings. Marketable securities not classified as held to maturity or as trading,&#13;are classified as available for sale, and are carried at fair value, with the unrecognized gains and losses, net of tax, included&#13;in the determination of comprehensive income (loss) and reported in shareholders&amp;#146; equity. The Company measures and discloses&#13;its investments in marketable securities, which are classified as available for sale, at fair value on a recurring basis, in accordance&#13;with the Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#147;ASC&amp;#148;). The cost of the securities sold is based on average cost of the&#13;security.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The fair value of substantially all&#13;securities is determined by quoted market prices. The estimated fair value of securities for which there are no quoted market prices&#13;is based on similar types of securities that are traded in the market.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -27pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Assets and Liabilities&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The estimated fair values for assets and liabilities are determined at discrete points in time based on relevant information.&#13;The ASC prioritizes inputs used in measuring fair value into a hierarchy of three levels: Level 1 &amp;#150; unadjusted quoted prices&#13;for identical assets or liabilities traded in active markets, Level 2 &amp;#150; observable inputs, other than quoted prices included&#13;within Level 1, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in markets that are not active or other&#13;inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the asset or liability;&#13;and Level 3 &amp;#150; unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists that are significant to the fair value of&#13;the assets or liabilities, therefore requiring an entity to develop its own assumptions that market participants would use in pricing.&#13;These estimates involve uncertainties and cannot be determined with precision. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize transfers&#13;into and out of Level 1, 2 and 3 categories as of the date of the event or change in circumstances occurs.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The following are the classes of assets&#13;and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis at June 30, 2015 and 2014, using quoted prices in active markets for&#13;identical assets (Level 1); significant other observable inputs (Level 2); and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3):&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="9" style="font-weight: bold; text-align: center"&gt;Fair Value at June 30, 2015&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;653,900&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;-&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;1,083,600&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Marketable Securities&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; At June 30, 2015, the Company had sold all of the Marketable Securities held at June 30, 2014. The Marketable Securities&#13;at June 30, 2014 were comprised entirely of ORBOCMM Inc. (&amp;#147;ORBCOMM&amp;#148;) common shares (NASDAQ: ORBC) acquired under the&#13;terms of the Asset Purchase Agreement between the Company and ORBCOMM for the asset sale of StarTrak. See Note 6 &amp;#150; Sale of&#13;StarTrak Systems, LLC for further discussion.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair&#13;Value of Asset Retirement Obligation&lt;/i&gt; &amp;#150; &lt;/b&gt;The Deer Creek asset retirement obligation is the estimated cost to close&#13;the Deer Creek facility under terms of the lease, meeting environmental and State of Colorado regulatory requirements. The estimate&#13;is determined at discrete points in time based upon significant unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists&#13;that is significant to the fair value of the liability, therefore requiring the Company to develop its own assumptions. Management&amp;#146;s&#13;estimate of the asset retirement obligation is based upon a cost estimate developed by a consultant knowledgeable of government&#13;closure requirements and costs incurred at similar water disposal facility operations. The process used was to identify each activity&#13;in the closure process, obtain vendor estimated costs, in current dollars, to perform the closure activity and accumulating the&#13;various vendor estimates to determine the asset retirement obligation. A present value discount has not been taken as the estimated&#13;closure costs, excluding regulatory changes and inflation adjustments, are anticipated to remain fairly consistent over the operational&#13;life of the facility. The lack of an active market to validate the estimated asset retirement obligation results in the fair value&#13;of asset retirement obligation to be a Level 3 fair value measurement. ASC Topic 410-20: Asset Retirement Obligations requires&#13;the Company to review the asset retirement obligation on a recurring basis and record changes in the period incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Contingent Payments&#13;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#150; The contingent land payment and contingent purchase price liabilities are also determined at discrete points in&#13;time based upon unobservable inputs in which little or no market activity exists that is significant to the fair value of the liability,&#13;therefore requiring the Company to develop its own assumptions. In calculating the estimate of fair value for both of the contingent&#13;payments, management completed an estimate of the present value of the contingent liability based upon projected income, cash flows&#13;and capital expenditures for the Deer Creek facility developed under plans currently approved by the Company&amp;#146;s board of directors.&#13;Different assumptions relative to the expansion or alternative uses of the Deer Creek and Indian Mesa facilities could result in&#13;significantly different valuations. The projected payments have been discounted at a rate of 3% per annum to determine net present&#13;value. The lack of an active market to validate the estimated contingent land liability results in the fair value of the contingent&#13;land liability to be a Level 3 fair value measurement. ASC Topic 820: Fair Value Measurement requires the Company to review the&#13;contingent land liability on a recurring basis and record changes in the period incurred. Pursuant to ASC Topic 820, during the&#13;fiscal year 2015 the Company reversed the contingent purchase price liability it had previously recorded based on the parameters&#13;of the contingency and the estimated present value based upon projected income, cash flows and capital expenditures for the Deer&#13;Creek and Indian Mesa facilities developed under plans currently approved by the Company&amp;#146;s board of directors.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; The Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, note receivable, accounts&#13;payable, and accrued liabilities. The fair value of these financial instruments approximates their carrying values using Level&#13;3 inputs, based on their short maturities or their effective interest rates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Land, Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&#13;&amp;#150; Land, Property and Equipment are stated at cost. Depreciation is computed over the estimated useful lives of the assets&#13;using the straight-line method, generally over a 3 to 20 year period. Currently all office furniture and equipment are being depreciated&#13;over 3 years; production equipment over 7 to 10 years; and the water disposal facility over 15 to 20 years including 15 years for&#13;the evaporation pond liners and 20 years for the pond construction costs. Expenditures for ordinary maintenance and repairs are&#13;charged to expense as incurred while betterments or renewals are capitalized. Upon retirement or disposal of assets, the cost and&#13;accumulated depreciation are eliminated from the account and any gain or loss is reflected in the statement of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trust Account &amp;#150; Asset Retirement&#13;Obligation&lt;/b&gt; &amp;#150; The Company is required to make quarterly payments to a trust account for the closure costs of the Deer&#13;Creek facility. The Company reflects the gross amount of the trust as an asset and the gross amount of the estimated closure cost&#13;as a liability.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt; - The Company accounts&#13;for income taxes under the asset and liability method, which requires recognition of deferred tax assets and liabilities for the&#13;expected future tax consequences of events that have been included in the financial statements or tax returns. Under this method,&#13;deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined based on the difference between the financial statement basis and tax basis&#13;of assets and liabilities using enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which the differences are expected to reverse. To the&#13;extent that the Company does not consider it more likely than not that a future tax asset will be recovered, it provides a valuation&#13;allowance against the excess. If the Company had an income tax obligation and if any interest or penalties were assessed related&#13;to an underpayment, the Company would recognize the interest or penalty due by charging any penalty to other operating expense&#13;and any interest to interest expense in the period that they are assessed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt; - The preparation&#13;of the Company's consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States&#13;of America requires the Company's management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in these consolidated&#13;financial statements and accompanying notes. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company makes significant estimates&#13;and assumptions concerning the classification and valuation of investments, the estimated fair value of stock-based compensation,&#13;realization of deferred tax assets, collectability of accounts and note receivable, estimated useful lives and carrying values&#13;of fixed assets, the recorded values of accruals and contingencies including the estimated fair values of the Company&amp;#146;s asset&#13;retirement obligation and the contingent land and purchase price liability, and the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going&#13;concern. Due to the uncertainties inherent in the estimation process and the significance of these items, it is at least reasonably&#13;possible that the estimates in connection with these items could be materially revised within the next year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/b&gt;&#13;- The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to perform an assessment for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that&#13;the carrying amount of a long-lived asset may not be recoverable. If the net carrying value of the asset exceeds estimated future&#13;undiscounted net cash flows, then an impairment is recognized to reduce the carrying value to the estimated fair value. No impairment&#13;charge was recorded in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2015. During fiscal year ended June 30, 2014, the Company recorded an impairment&#13;charge of $160,500 for an injection well located on the Deer Creek property as a result of meetings with State of Colorado officials&#13;and the uncertainty of a positive outcome on a permit to use the well.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt; - Basic&#13;EPS is calculated by dividing the income or loss available to common shareholders by the weighted average number of common shares&#13;outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution that could occur if securities or other contracts to issue&#13;common stock were exercised or converted into common stock. Basic and Diluted EPS were the same for fiscal 2015 and 2014, as the&#13;Company had net losses during both years and therefore the effect of all potential common stock equivalents is antidilutive (reduces&#13;loss per share).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Stock options representing 1,203,200&#13;shares of Class A Common Stock were outstanding at June 30, 2015 with exercise prices ranging between $0.50 and $1.50. The weighted&#13;average exercise price for all outstanding options was $0.58. Stock options representing 823,400 shares of Class A Common Stock&#13;were outstanding at June 30, 2014 with exercise prices ranging between $0.50 and $1.50. The weighted average exercise price for&#13;all outstanding options was $0.63.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Stock Options Plans&lt;/b&gt; - The Company&#13;has stock-based compensation plans. The value of the compensation cost is amortized on a straight-line basis over the requisite&#13;service periods of the award (the option vesting term).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -27pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company estimates the fair value&#13;of stock-based awards using the Black-Scholes valuation model. Assumptions used to estimate compensation expense are determined&#13;as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Expected term is determined under the simplified method using an average&#13;of the contractual term and vesting period of the award as appropriate statistical data required to properly estimate the expected&#13;term was not available;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.5in; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Expected volatility of award grants made under the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;plans is measured using the historical daily changes in the market price of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock over the expected&#13;term of the award, and contemplation of future activity; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Risk-free interest rate is to approximate the implied yield on zero-coupon&#13;U.S. Treasury bonds with a remaining maturity equal to the expected term of the awards; and,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 0.25in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Symbol"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Forfeitures are based on the history of cancellations of awards granted&#13;by the Company and management&amp;#146;s analysis of potential forfeitures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentrations&lt;/b&gt; - The Company&#13;holds cash and cash equivalents in bank accounts that in some cases exceeds the maximum FDIC insurance amount. At June 30, 2015&#13;and 2014, deposits in excess of FDIC insured limits amounted to $516,100 and $955,900, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Approximately 85.1% of AES revenues&#13;were generated by four customers during the fiscal year 2015 and all four customer accounts were current or paid in full as of&#13;June 30, 2015. During fiscal year 2014, 87.9% of AES revenues were generated by four customers and all amounts billed to those&#13;customers were current or paid in full as of June 30, 2014. The significant customers represented $14,900, or 32.4% of the accounts&#13;receivable balance at June 30, 2015, while the significant customers for fiscal 2014 represented $77,700, or 79.5% of the accounts&#13;receivable balance at June 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;In May 2014, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding revenue from contracts with customers. The guidance outlines a single comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting&#13;for revenue arising from contracts with customers and supersedes the most current revenue recognition guidance. In August 2015,&#13;this accounting pronouncement was deferred for one year, and is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December&#13;15, 2017, including interim reporting periods within that reporting period. Earlier application is permitted only as of reporting&#13;periods beginning after December 15, 2016. The Company is currently assessing the impact on its financial position and results&#13;of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;In April 2015, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding the imputation of interest and simplifying the presentation of debt issuance costs. The guidance is effective for annual&#13;reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2015 and early adoption is permitted. The Company has adopted the guidance, which&#13;had no material impact on its financial position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2015, the FASB issued guidance&#13;regarding technical corrections and improvements related to various topics as part of the FASB effort to clarify, simplify and&#13;improve guidance. The guidance is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2015 and early adoption is&#13;permitted. The Company has adopted the guidance, which had no material impact on its financial position and results of operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;There have been no other recent accounting&#13;pronouncements or changes in accounting pronouncements that are of significance, or potential significance, to us.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>    <us-gaap:ShareholdersEquityAndShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company has several employee stock&#13;option and officer and director stock option plans that have been approved by the shareholders of the Company. The plans require&#13;that options be granted at a price not less than market on the date of grant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company uses the Black-Scholes&#13;option pricing model to estimate fair value of stock-based awards.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-indent: 0.75pt"&gt;No options were granted during the&#13;year ended June 30, 2014. Assumptions for the award of options granted during the year ended June 30, 2015 were:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-indent: 0.75pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="7" style="text-align: center"&gt;Awards Granted in the Year Ended&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"&gt;Assumption&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="7" style="text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid"&gt;June 30, 2015&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 70%; text-align: left"&gt;Dividend yield&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 10%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 18%; text-align: right"&gt;0&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="width: 1%; text-align: left"&gt;%&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left"&gt;Expected volatility&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: left"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;62&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="text-align: left"&gt;%&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="11"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;and the closing price of the Company's common stock as of June 30, 2015 and 2014, for those awards that have an&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="10"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;exercise price currently below the closing price as of June 30, 2015 of $0.28 and as of June 30, 2014 of $0.48.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="11"&gt;&amp;#160;(3) Aggregate Fair Value is calculated using the Black Scholes option pricing model to estimate fair value of stock-based&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;compensation.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company recognized approximately&#13;$73,300 of stock-based compensation expense during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2015, which included $41,800 of stock-based compensation&#13;expense for options granted during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2015 and $31,500 for stock issued for services as described in&#13;Note 13. There is $27,700 of unamortized stock-based compensation expense related to these options which is scheduled to be recognized&#13;in the first two quarters of fiscal 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: center"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;All options granted had an exercise&#13;price of not less than the market price on date of grant, as stipulated in the stock option plans, of the Company&amp;#146;s common&#13;stock. As of June 30, 2015, 156,000 of the 390,000 stock options granted during fiscal 2015 to management and the Board of Directors&#13;were unvested and all options had a weighted average grant date fair value of $0.18 per share. These unvested options will vest&#13;equally over the next two fiscal quarters. There were no other unvested options at June 30, 2015. If not previously exercised,&#13;options outstanding at June 30, 2015 will expire as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s Stock Option Plans are administered&#13;by the Compensation/Administration Committee, currently comprised of two independent members of the Company&amp;#146;s Board of Directors.&#13;Company stock options are issued to employees and directors at an exercise price of not less than the fair market value, as determined&#13;under the option plan on the date of grant and must be granted within 10 years from the effective date of the Plan, with the term&#13;of the option not exceeding 10 years. Options granted to employees under the Stock Option Plans, which are terminated prior to&#13;exercise, are considered to be available for grant to subsequent employees. Total issued stock options for any plan may exceed&#13;those authorized due to termination of prior non-exercised grants. Under the Employee Incentive Stock Option Plans, incentive and&#13;non-qualified stock options may be granted with the incentive stock options intended to qualify under Section 422 of the Internal&#13;Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. Stock options issued during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2015 vested 20% on December 31, 2014&#13;and 20% each quarter thereafter and there were no options issued during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 100%; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;Notes receivable - current&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;60,000&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;$&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="border-top: Black 0.5pt solid; border-bottom: Black 2pt double; text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;300,000&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: white"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;&lt;p style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The $322,800 balance at June 30,&#13;2015 represents the outstanding amount drawn by ACC on a $322,800 credit line provided by the Company at June 30, 2015. The note&#13;is secured by all assets of ACC and at June 30, 2015 bears interest at the rate of 9.5% per annum. The note was modified multiple&#13;times during the fiscal year 2015 with a total of $29,000 of fees being added, which includes $9,000 of accounting fees and $20,000&#13;of loan fees. In addition, the interest rate was increased to 9.5% per annum effective October 1, 2014 and effective January 31,&#13;2015, the minimum monthly payments were changed to the greater of $5,000 or 10% of ACC&amp;#146;s gross monthly revenues. The modification&#13;dated January 29, 2015 modified the maturity date to August 31, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2015, ACC and the Company&#13;again modified the loan agreement by extending the maturity date to August 31, 2017. All other terms of the note, including the&#13;interest rate of 9.5% and the minimum monthly required payments of the greater of $5,000 or 10% of ACC&amp;#146;s gross monthly revenues&#13;remained the same.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company has reviewed ACC&amp;#146;s&#13;current projections which are based on the Executive Action issued by President Obama in November 2014. The action is designed&#13;to expand the original deferred action program to eligible parents and spouses of U.S. citizens and agricultural workers with a&#13;demonstrated history. In February 2015, twenty-six states filed a lawsuit to stop the program and the court granted an injunction&#13;meaning that the U.S. Government cannot proceed with rolling out the program. The U.S. government has appealed the lawsuit which&#13;is now pending in the 5&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; Circuit Court of Appeals with an anticipated ruling in late September 2015. The ACC projections&#13;anticipate that the court case will go all the way to the Supreme Court which would delay a decision to June 2016. It is possible&#13;that the 5&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; Circuit Court of Appeals could lift the injunction allowing ACC to proceed with providing service or, only&#13;allow the injunction as to the states that are part of the lawsuit in which case ACC could proceed with providing service in California,&#13;a state not part of the lawsuit. No provision for collectability has been recorded as of June 30, 2015 as current ACC financial&#13;projections indicate the note will be paid under the amended terms. Based on the minimum monthly payments of $5,000, the Company&#13;has classified $60,000 of the note as current and $262,800 of the note as long-term at June 30, 2015. Loan activity subsequent&#13;to June 30, 2015 consisted of a total of $17,200 in principal payments for June, July and August 2015. In addition, required interest&#13;payments were current.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:LoansNotesTradeAndOtherReceivablesDisclosureTextBlock>    <us-gaap:MarketableSecuritiesTextBlock contextRef="From2014-07-01to2015-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 22.5pt; text-align: justify"&gt;At June 30, 2015, the Company had&#13;no Marketable Securities on hand. At June 30, 2014, the Company had Marketable Securities, which are classified as available for&#13;sale, in the amount of $560,100 representing the June 30, 2014 market value ($6.59 per share) of 85,000 ORBCOMM Common Shares (&lt;b&gt;NASDAQ:&#13;ORBC&lt;/b&gt;) received as partial consideration in the May 2011 sale of StarTrak assets. During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2014,&#13;the Company settled the escrow and working capital obligations with ORBCOMM and all the shares previously held in escrow were released&#13;to the Company. The settlement is more fully discussed in Note 6 &amp;#150; Sale of StarTrak Systems, LLC.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 20.25pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The shares held are revalued at&#13;the end of each reporting period with per share market value fluctuations reported as Comprehensive Income (Loss) for the period.&#13;The Company recorded an unrealized loss on marketable securities sold during the twelve months ended June 30, 2015 of ($18,000),&#13;plus an adjustment of ($103,200) for unrealized gains previously recorded related to securities sold during the period. The actual&#13;gain on securities sold is reported in the Statement of Operations. All shares were sold as of December 31, 2014. At June 30, 2015&#13;and 2014, the Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income of $0 and $121,200, respectively, net of tax of nil, was presented in the&#13;Shareholders&amp;#146; Equity section of the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 17.25pt; text-align: justify"&gt;During the fiscal year ended June&#13;30, 2015, the Company sold a total of 85,000 shares of ORBCOMM, Inc. Common Stock for total proceeds of $542,100, and an average&#13;selling price of approximately $6.38 per share, resulting in realized gains totaling $103,200.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 17.25pt; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 17.25pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The following table summarizes the&#13;activities related to investment in Marketable Securities for the year ended June 30, 2015.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;    &lt;td style="text-align: left"&gt;September 30, 2014&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right"&gt;40,000&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; border-top-color: Black; border-top-width: 0.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;5.16&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: center"&gt;$&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="text-align: right; border-top-color: Black; border-top-width: 0.5pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;206,500&lt;/td&gt;&#13;
